title: Test of Two Variances
text: Let the variance of workers $$1$$ and $$2$$ equal $$\sigma_1 $$and$$ $$\sigma_2 $$respectively$$. $$The$$ $$workers$$ $$are$$ $$concerned$$ $$with$$ $$variation$$ $$of$$ $$commute$$ $$times$$, $$therefore$$ $$a$$ $$test$$ $$of$$ $$two$$ $$variances$$ $$will$$ $$be$$ $$performed$$.
speech: Let the variance of workers  1  and  2  equal  sigma sub 1 and \sigma_2  respectively .    t h e,   workers   a r e,   concerned   with   variation   o f   commute   times ,  therefore   a   test   o f   t w o,   variances   will   b e   performed .

title: Test of Two Variances
text: If the first worker thinks that he is more consistent, then that signals that his variance in time to commute to work is smaller than the second worker. Let that claim be the alternative hypothesis.
speech: If the first worker thinks that he is more consistent, then that signals that his variance in time to commute to work is smaller than the second worker. Let that claim be the alternative hypothesis.
pacedSpeech: If the first worker thinks that he is more consistent, then that signals that his variance in time to commute to work is smaller than the second worker. Let that claim be the alternative hypothesis.

title: Test of Two Variances
text: By default, since the workers commute at the same place in the same distances, the variances will be equal to each other.
speech: By default, since the workers commute at the same place in the same distances, the variances will be equal to each other.

title: Test of Two Variances
text: Since we are interested in comparing the two sample variances, we use the F ratio. A test of two variances may be left, right, or two-tailed.
speech: Since we are interested in comparing the two sample variances, we use the F ratio. A test of two variances may be left, right, or two-tailed.
